cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SSW of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across the Cayman Islands and western Cuba, then north-northwest through the central Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast (Louisiana/Mississippi) late Sunday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (near the mouth of the Mississippi River)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watches/Warnings limited to Cayman Islands and western Cuba at this time; no U.S. coastal watches yet.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cayman Islands; Cuban provinces of Matanzas, Mayabeque, Havana, Artemisa, Pinar del Rio, Isle of Youth under Tropical Storm Warning.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from eastern Texas through Louisiana to the western Florida Panhandle expected to feel impacts, with highest risk over southeast Louisiana.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely by Sunday with a 61 % chance; hurricane-force winds (50-kt probability 27 %) possible if the system strengthens as forecast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for significant storm surge exceeding 3 ft along the southeast Louisiana coast and inside lower Mississippi River, depending on exact track/intensity.
weather_observation.rainfall: Very heavy rainfall possible Sundayâ€“Monday; totals in excess of 4 inches likely with localized higher amounts leading to flash flooding along the river and low-lying terminals.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large waves, dangerous surf/river current interaction, and possible Mississippi River level rise could disrupt vessel traffic and cargo operations.
